title: Hidden gem
review: Very close to the temple complex. Brilliantly maintained and guarded. Desolate, as expected. No entry fee. Very, very good collection of small figurines from 10th to 13th century. Not only the deities, look for the refinement and emotion in the faces of ordinary hill people.You will find our ancestors living still!

title: Good
review: I wish there were more statues & detailed information regarding the same. Yet,it is a nice place if you are interested in archaeological artefacts.

title: museum of Hindu God and Goddess
review: There are 60 artifacts displayed in the museum recovered from Jageshwar group of temples and vicinity. The displayed objects includes stone idols of Hindu god and goddesses belongs to 9th - 14th C AD . The noteworthy figure is a metal image of Pona King assignable to 9th century AD.	It remains open from 10.00 am to 5.00 pm.

title: need to remove shoes
review: this was the first museum i ever visited where you need to remove your shoes to enter. but it was good. kept the sanctity of the place and kept it away from unwanted dust and dirt. ofcourse it was fully carpeted so wasnt a problem.

title: Must Visit Place@Almora
review: Very nice place. There are 60 artifacts displayed in the museum recovered from Jageshwar group of temples and vicinity. It's just in front of Almora main bus stand. This museum should be handed over to ASI.All the items are very beautiful and priceless. Proper maintenance is required. There is no entry fee for museum.Visiting hours 10:30am - 4:30Pm , weekly holiday is Monday.We liked it very much.

title: A must-visit for history buffs and iconography enthusiasts
review: Located very close to the Jageshwar Dham temple complex, the Archaeological museum is really a treasure trove for history and iconography lovers. It is very well maintained, and you will need to open your shoes to enter this place (although I am not sure whether that is for cleanliness as shoe dust might damage the artifacts, or for religious reasons, as they objects in display are idols of Hindu gods and goddesses not very far away from the original temple complex). We were dying and pleading to take photographs, but photography is not allowed there at any cost. Another thing to note is that museum stays closed on Mondays, so plan ahead.

title: Nice visit
review: helps to imagine what archaeologists must have felt when they discovered the statues in this dense forest away from human intervention

title: Dont miss this gem!
review: If you are a history buff you LL really like this small museum. The 9-13th century idols from jageshwar dham have been placed here

title: Good Museum
review: Good museum for people who are interested in history and culture of Jageshwar temples. The statues are dated from 700 AD till 15 century. Great collection for art enthusiasts.

title: Know more about Jageshwar Dham
review: You may know much better about Jageshwar Dham after visiting this meusiam. Lot of small shivlings are kept in this meusiam from temple. All researches were done by Archeological department GOV India.

title: Enrich your Jageshwar trip...
review: Collection of very beautiful of statues of various Gods and Goddesses are kept here in the museum, predominantly Shivlings. Statues/ artefacts found and recovered from the nearby areas which belong to Jageshwar temples have been preserved and kept in this museum.

title: Jageshwar Museum
review: Musem with sculptures dating 8 to 12 century. Nicely carved sculptures of gods and goddesses, worth watching

title: a treasure trove
review: this museum is opposite the Jageshwar Dham complex

title: A Must Visit for those visiting the Jageshwar Dham
review: Its a small Museum situated just on the opposite side of the Jageshwar Dham. It contains Deities of 08th Century-14th Centuries, which were originally there in the Jageshwar Dham and other surrounding temples. They have been collected and preserved by the Archaeological Society of India. One should not miss the place as its just in front of the car parking area for the Dham.

title: Must visit opposite Jageshwar Temple
review: This museum gives us glimpse of the history of Jageshwar Dham as well Vridh Jageshwar. One should ensure that it is open during visit, as few days a week it is closed.

title: Good find
review: Awesome collection and really great storage by the Archaeological team.. Worth visiting. Near the temple

title: a peek into history
review: about 20 mins from the jageshwar temple complex next to the parking area, this museum houses figurines and idols of gods and goddesses excavated from jageshwar. the three galleries is a treasure trove of those finds and is a must visit. the government has maintained is really well and a guard take you around the museum.

title: Make a quick stop for a lesson in history
review: Make a quick stop for a lesson in history and get marveled looking at the gorgeous idols of 8th & 9th century on display.

title: most of the idols of jageshwar dham are kept here in safe custody but can be seen. timings 9.30am to 6pm.Friday closed
review: must for everybody to visit museam and see the orignal idols of jageshwar temple complex.this is must also to know the history of temple complex and understand complete value of this place.

title: Nice and Informative
review: This Location is Appropriate location for the museum. Right beside the Temple Complex. Once we visit the temples; we can visit this museum on way back.

title: Small museum containing the best statues of 9th-12th centuries. One of the richest museum anywhere in the world.
review: This small archaeological museum was built in the year 2000 and houses 174 beautiful sculptures from the temples of Jageshwar from the period of 9th to 12th centuries.The museum has two galleries and the masterpiece statues are of Uma Maheshwar, the Surya and the rare sculptures of Navagriha. The central hall has the beautiful sculpture of Pona Raja during whose reign most of the temples were constructed and the most beautiful sculptures made.

title: A SMALL MUSEUM OF JAGESHWAR
review: The Archaeological Museum of Jageshwar is managed by Archaeological Survey of India (ASI). Jageshwar can be reached from Almora ( about 35 km),

title: Much Ado about something
review: I was quite disappointed to visit this archaeological museum as I expected much, perhaps. The entrance is covered with a curtain and  the inside is very reclusive.  Some of the deities are very rare and old. But you are not allowed with your shoe inside  and that's astonishing.

title: Surprised to see 9 to 13 century idol of our Hindu Gods & Goddesses, which were damaged by Mughal kings.
review: Must see this museum, its free. Do read each every history of our hindu God & Goddesses,  see the carving done in years old centuries.

title: Well maintained beautiful sculptures
review: Do visit the museum to see some real art work! Has real old well maintained pieces. Museum itself is very quiet and clean!

title: wonderful experiance
review: Day1

title: Great Collection
review: The idols from the Jageshwar Temples are placed here, its a great collection of idols, architectural pieces and our history

title: Excellent Collection
review: The museum was started in 1995 by putting shed around the sculpture and later in 200 0 its was converted into museum. The place god excellent collection of the sculpture  of the temples nearby. It is well worth a look and visit the place.

title: Good if you love history
review: The museum has good but very few collection. Its on the way to the main temple complex. So can be seen.

title: Don't miss
review: This museum is just below the KMVN guest house. Small but has wonderful sculptures from the 8th-12th centuries. Must visit. Of particular interest is the metal image of Pon Raja, removed from the temple and kept here

title: Well maintained and preserved artefacts
review: Free entry, well maintained and preserved artefacts. Worth a visit. Located right across the road from the Jageshwar temple
